author: Jamar
comment: When I say start or open "thermostat control", the watch takes me to the web and does not open the app.

author: Sarah Hodge
comment: Very handy. I like that I can preheat my home on my drive from work
title: The Nests missing feature

author: David Leslie
comment: Working well with LG Urbane, very nice looking interface. Way better than the Android Wear apps that come with Calida

author: Ian Bowers
comment: And does it well!  Which is more than I can say for most of the other Wear implementations of Nest controls.
title: Works as described

author: Kris Benbow
comment: As far as I’m aware, there are only a couple of apps available for controlling the Nest thermostat on Android Wear devices and this one is by far the best by quite some margin. The design is visually top class, and the voice control works perfectly. Also the ability to set the Thermostat into ‘Home’ & ‘Away’ mode directly from the watch is extremely useful!  Excellent communication from the developer when I had some queries after first installing.   All in all, just what I’ve been looking for to control the Nest from my Moto 360.

author: Carsten Dressler
comment: Thank you for this perfect app!  Could you please add option to turn on the fan?  I know the APIs restrict you, but you can turn it on.  Thanks

reply.author: {epr}.io
reply.content: Unfortunately this ability is not available via the standard API therefore it's unlikely we can implement it without some 'dirty' work around

title: Works great!

author: Jaren Means
comment: Yes. I have my house divided into two homes (zones) so they will go auto away independently. That must be why I'm having an issue.

reply.author: {epr}.io
reply.content:
UPDATE 01/08/15 - This issue has now been fixed as of v1.42

Do you have multiple structures/homes? If so we know of an issue with this which we are currently working on to fix

title: Won't connect to my nests

author: Andrew Staley
comment: If I say "Set Dining Room to 65 degrees." the app sets it to 265 degrees. Also, the ability to switch the thermostat's mode would be helpful. (ie heat, cool, off) and to be able to control the fan timer.

reply.author: {epr}.io
reply.content:
Thanks for the review. We did have that issue in testing but unfortunately we use goggles speech recognizer which causes it to make it a '2' rather than 'to'. An easy fix is simply say 'set dining room, 65 degrees' until we work around this issue. 

In regards to heat and cool mode, that is in the pipeline for the next beta.

title: Issue with voice command...

author: Mark Davis
comment: This app does handle multiple thermostats, but it doesn't seem to handle both heating and cooling settings.  There's no indication of how to choose which set point (low or high) to modify, and modifying the set point doesn't seem to do what it's supposed to.  Good try, but I'm returning this until it actually handles this basic use case.

reply.author: {epr}.io
reply.content: UPDATE 12-10-15: This functionality has now been improved in version 1.5 whereby you can select the high and low values and adjust each one separately as per the nest app.

title: Doesn't handle AC + heat

author: Chuck Musciano
comment: As the only Wear app that correctly manages multiple Nests, this is a great app.  However, it has a few shortcomings.  Specifically, it does not know if the thermostat is off, heating, or cooling.  As a result, it always shows a temperature below the set point as red (heating) and above the set point as green (cooling).  This can be confusing, since you'll think your Nest is running when it isn't.  If this could be corrected, this would be a five-star app!

reply.author: {epr}.io
reply.content:
Thanks for the review. I'm currently working on the next update and I will definitely add this feature into the app.

UPDATE 21/04/15 - This functionality is now available in version 1.4

title: Works well, needs a few more features

author: Jordan Hogan

reply.author: {epr}.io
reply.content:
Thanks for the tip. We'll try and correct this on the next update coming soon

UPDATE 12-10-15: We have made some improvements to the layouts in version 1.5 which should hopefully make everything look a bit more centred

title: Works well, location name label is offset incorrectly on SmartWatch 3

author: Tim Arndt
comment: Does exactly what you would expect it to do stock. Helpful addition!
title: Great stuff

author: Giuseppe Mancone
comment: This app does what Nest should have done with their own app. A simple and elegant way to check and control your temperature/away status from your wrist. If you have a nest you will not regret this purchase.

reply.author: {epr}.io
reply.content: Thanks for your review. Trust me, this is just the start. We already have improvements and more features to come.

title: A++ Exactly what I wanted
